intro: Anteriorchis × kallithea, commonly known as the hybrid kallithea, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix and a spathe. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte or lithophyte, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its foliage consists of broad, glossy leaves that are often variegated with shades of green and white. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is highly sought after by botanical enthusiasts and conservationists alike.
